hypothesis_content.title: Central Bank Surprise → Cross-Asset Volatility Transfer to BTC
hypothesis_content.statement: A surprise central bank decision (e.g., BoJ hike) that triggers >1.5% move in DXY and/or 10Y Treasury yields within 30 minutes will cause a correlated, amplified move in BTC over the next 6-12 hours as global liquidity expectations reprices.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC increasingly acts as a global liquidity barometer. Surprise CB actions force rapid repricing of dollar liquidity and risk appetite. The initial FX/rates move is often followed by a larger, delayed move in crypto as macro hedge funds and cross-asset traders adjust portfolios. The amplification stems from crypto's lower liquidity and higher beta to liquidity shocks.
entry_conditions: DXY moves >0.8% OR 10Y UST yield moves >12 bps within 30 minutes of a scheduled CB decision
BTC 15-min correlation to DXY/UST over the prior 24 hours is > |0.3|
Enter on the first 15-min BTC candle close confirming direction: if DXY spikes ↑, short BTC; if DXY drops ↓, long BTC

exit_conditions.take_profit: When BTC has moved 1.8x the magnitude of the DXY move (in % terms, capped at 6% BTC move)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price moves 0.5x the DXY move in the wrong direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the BTC move magnitude is less than 1.2x the DXY move over 12 hours in >60% of cases (sample of 8 events).
